citations.narrative:
On April 22, 2023, a nonhuman primate was found deceased in its primary enclosure after becoming entangled in an
enrichment device. According to facility representatives, the chain used to attach a device to the enclosure was 31.5cm
long and constructed of >4 chain links, which was long enough to be pulled into the enclosure to form a loop in which the
animal became entrapped. On review of the facility's plan for environmental enhancement that was in place at the time of
the incident, the length of chain used exceeded the length approved for attaching items that are accessible to animals in
the enclosure.
Attachment of a device accessible to the animal with a chain of this length created an enclosure set up that did not protect
the animal from injury. Primary enclosures, including any fixtures attached to those enclosures, must be constructed and
maintained to protect the nonhuman primates from injury.
This incident was voluntarily reported to USDA and corrective measures, including review of all enrichment devices in use
at the facility, had been implemented prior to inspection. To remain corrected after December 18, 2023 by ensuring
enclosures used to house nonhuman primates are constructed and maintained in a manner that protects the animals from
injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
